prompt.welcome:
Welcome and thank you for participating in our study! 
 Before we start, you'll have to adjust the loudness of the sounds that are being presented. 
 When you are ready, press enter ⏎ to start and follow the instructions on the screen
prompt.calibration:
Lower the volume by pressing the arrow key down ↓ until you can't hear it anymore.
 Then, use the arrow key up ↑ to increase the volume until you can hear it again.
 
 The sound should now be just barely loud enough for you to detect it. You can use the arrow keys ↓ ↑ to further adjust the level. 
 
 Once you are done, press enter ⏎ to confirm.
prompt.threshold: Now, you will have to detect tones while continuous background noise is playing. Half of all trials contain a tone, the others do not. They are presented in a random order. Your task is to determine whether or not a given trial contained a tone. You will initiate each trial yourself by pressing the space key ␣. Fixate the white dot that appears on the screen and listen for the tone. After some time a prompt will appear that asks you whether you heard a tone. Press 1 if you heard a tone or press 2 if you didn't. The loudness of the tone will be automatically adjusted so that it will be harder to detect the tone as the task goes on. When you are ready, press enter ⏎ to start.
prompt.blocks:
Good job! Now the main experiment begins. 
 The task remains the same: you start each trial by pressing space ␣ and, at the end of the trial, press 1 if you heard the sound or 2 if you didn't. The whole experiment is divided into short blocks of 50 trials and you can take a break after each block. When you are ready, press enter ⏎ to start.
prompt.start: Press the space key ␣ to start the next trial.
prompt.response:
Did you hear a tone? 
 If yes, press 1 - if no, press 2.
